column6: Smallest viruses replicating autonomously in eukaryotic cells.[44]
Often used as a vector for the cloning of recombinant DNA.
Until 2013 the largest known viral genome.[52]
First genome of a living organism sequenced July 1995[56]
First genome of a bryophyte sequenced January 2008.[71]
First multicellular animal genome sequenced December 1998[76]
Size variation based on strain (175-180Mb; standard y w strain is 175Mb)[77]
Homo sapiens estimated genome size 3.2 billion bp[82]

Organism type: Initial sequencing and analysis of the human genome[83]

column6: Bonobo -  estimated genome size 3.29 billion bp[84]
Smallest vertebrate genome known estimated to be 340 Mb[86][87] – 385 Mb.[88]
